meanings.sent1: The spy left behind an untraceable trail.
meanings.sent2: The hacker made the source of the virus untraceable.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act was so untraceable, even the audience was amazed.
meanings.sent4: The criminal's movements were as untraceable as a ghost in the night.
meanings.sent5: The treasure's location remained untraceable, hidden from all who sought it.

meanings.definition: Unable to be followed or located
meanings.sent1: The missing cat seemed untraceable in the vast forest.
meanings.sent2: The signal from the lost ship was untraceable due to the storm.
meanings.sent3: The secret recipe for the famous dish was so untraceable that even the chef couldn't find it.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps in the snow were untraceable, disappearing with each gust of wind.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the rare flower was untraceable, teasing the botanists searching for it.
